title: Differentiation Density Upgrade
summary: Every verdict must include mechanism and friction, not only constraint and failure.
what_this_is: Defines the minimum explanatory density required for a comparison to remain valid at scale.
structural_problem: Constraint-only verdicts create semantic repetition and corpus interchangeability.
rule: Every failure claim must specify the concrete mechanism and the user-facing friction it produces under the constraint.
tradeoff: Comparisons lacking behavioral grounding are rejected or delayed.
failure_mode: Pages become thin, repetitive, and less credible as claims detach from observable behavior.
structural_impact: Row Triage and Page Factory must enforce mechanism → friction → failure to preserve distinction at scale.
